text: Outstanding traditional foreign Stout. Aroma is a hint of licorice roast dark malt coffee. Flavor is like nose coffee comes out more in the Finish very nice.

Bottle shared. Dark brown with a small ring tan head. Aroma of light roast, chocolate, light seawater notes, toffee and coffee. Flavour is above moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled from bottle at kermis German trophy tasting. Black with thin cream ring head. Sweet deep roasted chocolate malts. Seashells, licorice, hints of coffee and charcoal. Moderate sweet and bitter, some saltiness. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry chalky mouthfeel.

0,33lFlasche. Ganz dunkles Mahargoni, fast Schwarz. Cremiger brauner Schaum. Es duftet nach Rum, Brandy, Schokolade und Röstmalz. Wuchtig im Antrunk. Röstmalz. Säure und Schokolade. Sehr salzig im Mittelteil. Sanft rauchig.
Danke an drnosha, Schwarzes Bier cremiger schaum, malz Kaffee röstmalz im Geruch, ich Geschmack kräftig malzig röstmalz Kaffee sehr salzig cremiges mundgefühl, lecker
Very dark brown, khaki head that lasts. Heavily roasted aroma and flavor with more than expected bitterness, some dark fruit and light brine. Im a fan of the style, and this was done pretty well.

Bottle purchased and consumed at Oxbow Portland. Pours a rich burnt umber with three fingers of khaki foam. Nose is roast forward with some underlying dried plum, ash and bakers cocoa. Palate follows with medium to full mouthfeel, soft carbonation even though there was quite a head, lots of roasted grain, spent coffee grounds, tangy plum, salty cocoa. Slight metallic flavor lingers which detracts a bit from the overall appeal but a decent offering.

Bottle many thx to Erzengel cons 2017-04-17 Göteborg
AR: heavy roasted malt, black chocolate, sour coffee,
AP: dark brown body, wee traces of cream brown head
F: heavy roasted malt, sour coffee, hint of dark chocolate, wee ink - dont think oyster shells and anything to a beer?! Second thought salt liquorice,,,

BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch black, dark espresso head. Really thick aroma of dried prunes, sticky burnt sugar thrown into a strong well roasted espresso. The taste is similar, but not up to the richness of the aroma, leaving you listing for more body. The finish is moderately bitter, slightly acid, with some ashes in the after taste. Quite good.
From bottle to glass. Pours an inky black with no head. Chocolate and slight funk in the aroma. Flavor is dry cocoa. Dry finish.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours dark brown with a transient tan head and a treacle and oyster aroma. There is a hearty smoked malt flavor with some dark molasses, a little chocolate and a lot chocolate of oyster. A pleasant drink.

Bottle from Craft Beer Kings. Pours dark brn/blk with a slight dark tan head. Aroma is dark, dark sugar and dark dark malt. Touch of chocolate. Med body or so. Flavor is slightly sweet, dark malt, touch of acidity, some smokiness. Nice drink.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Pours deep brown, almost black with a medium tan head that disappears quickly. Poor lacing. Nose is medium roasted coffee beans, licorice, peat. Hints of liquor. Taste starts salty and ends slightly bitter and smokey. Soy sauce, shellfish, smoked wood, dark chocolate - all flavours extremely balanced. Medium body, low carbonation. An extremely well done, smooth stout.

(bottle, 33cl) Black colour with a brown and firm short foamy head. Roasty malty aroma with deep notes of coffee and grounded coffee beans, accompanied by hints of dark chocolate, vanilla and a whiff of smoke. Roasty bitter and delicately sweet and salty flavour, medium to full bodied with a soft carbonation. Dark and roasted malt character with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, minerals, peanuts, shades of leather and subtle dried fruity notes; moderately roasty bitter, slightly salty and delicately sour finish with notes of chocolate, coffee and shades of peanuts in the aftertaste. Quite complex and really good. 03.XII.16

Draught at the 20th Pizza Port Strong Ale Festival. Pours opaque black with a large, frothy tan head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate roast and chocolate malt, shellfish, lightly metallic with prunes and earthy hops. Flavor is heavy roast and chocolate malt, metallic shellfish, prunes and figs with a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Bottle @ Muted Horn - Pours pitch black, nearly no (beige) head. Like pouring oil in a glass. Notes of cocoa, coffee. Thick malty body. Medium sweet, very well balanced. Slightly burning sensation in the throat. Dry. Easily drinkable. Dangerous stuff.

Gourmet-Flasche: Literally black, small but stable tanned foamy layer; moderate to solid sweet-bitter aroma of roasted malt, caramel, bitter chocolate and wanilla and vood, maybe traces of peat as well; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied and soft; lingering toasty and fruity finish with an increasing bitter dryness towards the end. Wow! An unexpected gem from the Sauerland...

330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, tan head. Compact, intense, chocolately, roasty dark malty aroma, a minimally smoky touch, hints of plum, some coffee, espresso, pumpernickel. Taste is bitter, roasty dark malty, minimally salty and smoky, chocolately, hints of cocoa, vanilla, a touch of blood and iron. Oily texture, creamy palate.
Bottle at home, 6th October 16. Pours black and slick. Aroma is complex, cocoa, smoke, vanilla. Taste is rich, bitter smoke, vanilla, very smooth. Very nice

Really dark brown color with mocha head. Aroma has chocolate, smoked malt and some dried plums. Taste starts with smoked peppers, roasted malts, continues with some dark chocolate and finishes with bitter coffee roastiness. Medium to light bodied with medium carbonation. Overall its quite nice. Easy drinking for the ABV.

Draught at Tribaun, Innsbruck. 
Pitch bkack body, with a medium, dense, creamy, lacing, dark beige head. 
Aroma of coffee, cocoa powder, liquorice, dark chocolate, some caramel, subtle vanilla.
Taste follows this, with even more dry espresso like notes and subtle dark fruits.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty, dry, wooden, with espresso, cocoa powder, liquorice. 

Tasty. Very characterful, with a dense coffee-aroma and a great dryness, yet quite smooth to drink. Very well hidden ABV, alcohol isnt really noticeable. Really great, accomplished style example.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Lots of bready roasted malts, Schwarzbrot, dark, but really not that typical coffee/chocolate/vanilla type, some liquorice though. Medium to heavy body with a soft carbonation and a hint of booze. Ripe dark fruits on the tongue, but highly condensed, almost like a syrup or a liquor. Rather short finish, some milky sourness on the palate. A good experience!

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Lively small brown head. Black beer.
Nose of roast, coffee, metallic and some mocha tints...
Flavours of roast, chocolate, nuts, mocha, cacoa, bitters, coffee...
Aftertaste is bitter and roasty with metallic choco and coffee notes. Not sweet
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel and more than medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small off white head. Aroma is slight fruity. Dark roasted malty, breadish. Bitter and roasted. Dry and dark malty. Overripe fruity finish.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours a black color with a beige head. Nose is roasted malts, bit of chocolate, vanilla,

Bottle 33cl
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, licorice.
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 Pinta en La Tape (Madrid) Color negro, fina corona de espuma duradera, buen cuerpo, toques de chocolate, cafe, malta, buen aroma

Bottle from Rudat. Great intense chocolate nose. The beer starts fishy (oyster?) with an intense and sticky deep salmiak aroma (like the small black candies from the pharmacy).Then the aroma turns to smooth espresso with hints of chocolate. In the aftertaste, the salmiak is still there, roast, chocolate, espresso. Very interesting but extremely deep!

A malty aroma, some soja sauce. The head is medium large, beige and fizzy with a short duration. The body is black, A rather bitter and sour taste, light malty. The body is medium strong, light creamy with a soft carbonation

0,33l bottle at home. Did not find the BB date. black color, small coffee colored head. smells of earthy notes, some smoke, licorice, light vanilla, bitter chocolate, coffee. good smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, spices, some dark fruits, spices, some vanilla, bitter chocolate, some caramel, light alcohol. finishes light to medium bitter with notes of bitter chocolate and earthy / smoky notes. overall quite good one, a bit too bitterish for me. not well rounded enough, also a bit on the smoke / earthy side. overall still nicely drinkable though.

(draught) black in colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of toasted malts, marzipan and liquorice, with a light touch of cherry skins and fudge. flavour is mostly sugar icing and fudge, with some more toasted malts, a hint of espresso and some ethanol in the semi-dry finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle from Berkeley bowl west. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malt. Taste is roasted malts with a light watery finish. Pretty good drinker

Tap at Beergeek. Opaque color, thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, ash, smoked malt, dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, nuts. Taste is balanced, coffee with vanilla, cocoa and dark chocolate, light smoky aroma, decent roastiness, mediym bitter finish

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks Vova. Black with a nice tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, a bit of coffee, smoky note, licorice note, and an alcohol note. Sweet flavor with dark chocolate, some coffee. Full-bodied, rounded, silky. Great.

33 cl bottle poured. Huge thanks to Alex for the share. Never knew of this beer. How the hell did Pizza Port get all the way out there? Pours a midnight black with an active tan fizz head. Toasty malt, and chocolate aroma. I only know the oyster shells are there because its advertised. Its not a quality I notice otherwise. Maybe a bit of salt and/or metallic going, but its covered with a moderate sweet chocolate consistency. Long and sweet chocolate, milky finish. Very nice stout here. Very much enjoyed this.

Natürlich drängen sich sofort die unvermeintlichen Röstaromen auf, dazu gesellen sich aber sofort extrem kantige Getreide und Würzaromen. Eine Sinfonie der Gefühle startet. EIN FEUERWERK!!! Extravagant, anders aber auch wieder bodenständig. Grosse Braukunst. 0,3/4-5 Euro auf dem 2ten BREMER BIERFEST 2016. Vom Fass.

Bottle 0.33l at my place Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Bottle from Zlotta. Share with him. Thanks man. 31.05.2016. Pour it dark color with black head. Aroma some coffee and some oyster shalves. Taste smooth mocha coffee, quite roasted malt with mix of that coffee, really smooth texture, nice, some chocolate as well. Medium to full body, easy drinkable. Good.

Tap at Beergeek, Freigeist tape over.Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste, roasted malt, strong coffee, plums, licorice, dak chocolate. Long chocolate, coffee bitter finish. Tasty.

Tap at Beergeek Bar Freigeist tap takeover. Assertively roasty, mostly dry, lots of coffeeish chocolatey flavours. Mostly bitter, with almost moderate body. Surprisingly easy drinking. Alcohol hidden well.
Black with light brown froth. Aroma has roasted malt and dark chocolate. Sweetish flavour, coffee, dark chocolate and licorice. Not bad.

Aroma is pretty hard roasted malts with a deeper and underlying sensation of sweetness. Slight notes of chocolates and licorice. Taste is slightly creamy and soft, but with a touch of soy sauce and coffee. Medium body and easy to drink. I could ask for some more oomph from the oysters though, but I guess that its them who gives this one a slight salty touch in the aftertaste. Pretty interesting stuff this one, and it works well even on a warm summer evening.

0.33 l bottle from craftbeer-dealer.com, bottled in spring 2016, shared at Markos place. Pitch black with a thin, tan layer. Sweetish-malty, roasty aroma of dark chocolate, hard roasted coffee, peanuts, some mocca and hints of vanilla. Sweetish-malty, roasty taste of dark chocolate, hard roasted coffee, peanuts, licorice and hints of vanilla, followed by a medium long, roasty-bitter finish. Medium to full body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really good! Well-balanced, not too much roast, only the body maybe lacks a bit for that abv.

From tap at Braukunstwerk tap-takeover; murky, intense black coloured with a small light-brown. Aroma: heavy roasted malt, smoked meat. Taste: initial taste is smokey, dark bread followed by chocolate flavors, very round, light bitter, slightly coffee in the finish. Finish is long. Full bodied, slightly creamy texture, medium carbonated. Oyster shells not tasteable.

Bottled. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and soy. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with a little bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Impy indeed. 🌟🌟🌟

From tap at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, oat, some chocolate. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

Among the memorable beers of the day, final fuller pour. - Spectacularly blends the transatlantic, mutually exotic sensations of deep roast malt textures of something like an Altbayrisch Dunkel with peppery American sweet liquorice root (root beer, Dr. Pepper), adding nuances of oven-baked bread, cola nuts, Nutella and forest after rain alike. High drinkability. A great crossover between Dunkel, Porter, Doppel-Alt - just not a RIS to me. Honestly did not pick up on the oyster shells at this point but Im sure it added to the dryness/drinkability.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, bitter chocolate, red fruits, slightly ashy.
Appearance: black color and brown head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, bitter chocolate, roasted malts, soya sauce, burnt malts.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Nice RIS, quite drinkable.
Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, mittelgroße beige Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Kaffee, trocken. Geschmack sehr schokoladig röstmalzig, bitter, Vanille, Kaffee ohne ende.
Schokoladig holziger Beginn, weich, cremig. Spritzig, vollmundig, langer röstiger Geschmack, wenig bitter. Die Malzigkeit bleibt dabei konstant, langer Nachhall. 12/12/12/12//12
